result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda M Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda M Smith in court. 
Cases heard are 22CF-94 and 22CF-192.

2:09:00 UDAR starts.

Drug Treatment Team Members are present.
 
Court reviews the participant's progress sheet and questions the participant. 
Participant states her progress/regression on the record. 
Issues are addressed. Orders are given.

Team member comments are stated on the record. 
Participant to be back in Court on October 4, 2022.

2:23:00 UDAR ends.
Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda M Smith
Current: 300 Division St., Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 08-22-2022)
Prior: 111 Dellwood Ln, Nekoosa, WI

$250 Cash Bond AMENDED to a $1,000 Signature Bond 
Alternative to Revocation:  So defendant can participate in the Portage County Adult Drug Treatment Court
Order to Amend Bond /s/ MDZ 08/19/22
Order to Amend Bond filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 08/18/22 sp)
Motion to Amend Bond filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 08/18/22 sp)
Plea/Sentencing set for 11/15/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
matter set for plea/sent 11/15/22 at 8:30
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Atty Raabe stands mute.
Court enters NOT GUILTY pleas to both files. 
Atty Jambois notes the defendant is being considered for an Alternative to Revocation program.  Stipulate to the cash bond to a signature bond.  
Atty Raabe agrees and asks the court if he should file a motion at the appropriate time. 
Court notes that would need to be done at the appropriate time. 
Atty Jambois states they will stipulate to the amendment. 

BY THE COURT:  Bonds continued.

3:42 PM   Prosecuting attorney Robert J Jambois in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amanda M Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Amanda M Smith.

Both files heard:  22CF94, 22CF192

Atty Raabe indicates he was not able to meet with the defendant as she was not brought up and asks the court to conduct a colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:39 PM Defendant Amanda M Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Amanda M Smith. Cases 22CF192 and 22CF94.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney doesn't waive time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Atty Adam Raabe appointed
Initial Appearance set for May 2, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2

1:23 PM Defendant Amanda Marie Smith appeared by video. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule is present for the Defendant.  22GF169 New Charge and Return on Warrant Case # 22CF94.
22GF169:
ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Misappropriate ID. 
Atty Taylor Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a $250 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

22CF94 Return on Warrant:
State asks for a $750 cash bond for the reasons stated.
Atty Soule's objections to cash bonds on both cases and requests for signature bonds.

BY THE COURT: Warrant is quashed and bonds are set:
$250 cash bond on both cases for a total of $500.00

Initial appearance scheduled in both cases.05-02-2022 at 1:15 pm
